    • Method Detail

      • complete

        public boolean complete(Submitter<Topology,? extends Job> submitter,
                        com.google.gson.JsonObject config,
                        Condition<?> endCondition,
                        long timeout,
                        java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit unit)
                 throws java.lang.Exception
        Description copied from interface: Tester
        Submit the topology for this tester and wait for it to complete, or reach an end condition. If the topology does not complete or reach its end condition before timeout then it is terminated.

        End condition is usually a Condition returned from Tester.atLeastTupleCount(TStream, long) or Tester.tupleCount(TStream, long) so that this method returns once the stream has submitted a sufficient number of tuples.
        Note that the condition will be only checked periodically up to timeout, so that if the condition is only valid for a brief period of time, then its valid state may not be seen, and thus this method will wait for the timeout period.

        Specified by:
        complete in interface Tester
        Parameters:
        submitter - the Submitter
        config - submission configuration.
        endCondition - Condition that will cause this method to return if it is true.
        timeout - Maximum time to wait for the topology to complete or reach its end condition.
        unit - Unit for timeout.
        Returns:
        The value of endCondition.valid().
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - Failure submitting or executing the topology.

      • getJob

        public Job getJob()
        Description copied from interface: Tester
        Get the Job reference for the topology submitted by complete().
        Specified by:
        getJob in interface Tester
        Returns:
        Job reference for the topology submitted by complete(). Null if the complete() has not been called or the Job instance is not yet available.

      • and

        public Condition<java.lang.Boolean> and(Condition<?>... conditions)
        Description copied from interface: Tester
        Return a condition that is valid only if all of conditions are valid. The result of the condition is Condition.valid()
        Specified by:
        and in interface Tester
        Parameters:
        conditions - Conditions to AND together.
        Returns:
        condition that is valid only if all of conditions are valid.
